birth_place.zh-cn: 大清山东省临清直隶州

death_place.zh-cn: 中华民国湖北省宜城县方家集
death_place.en: Fangjiaji, Yicheng County, Hubei, Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军二级上将，原西北军系将领，在枣宜会战中阵亡，是第二次世界大战中盟军阵亡的最高级别将领之一。
description.en: A general of the Republic of China Army, formerly a commander in the Northwestern Army. He was killed in action during the Battle of Zaoyang-Yichang, making him one of the highest-ranking Allied officers to be killed in World War II.

description.zh-cn: 张自忠的夫人。
description.en: Wife of Zhang Zizhong.

description.zh-cn: 张自忠的儿子。
description.en: Son of Zhang Zizhong.

description.zh-cn: 张自忠的儿子。
description.en: Son of Zhang Zizhong.

description.zh-cn: 张自忠的女儿。
description.en: Daughter of Zhang Zizhong.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家、政治家，西北军领袖，张自忠的早期上级。
description.en: A Chinese military leader and politician, leader of the Northwestern Army, and Zhang Zizhong's early superior.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家，国民革命军第二十九军军长，张自忠的上级。
description.en: A Chinese military leader, commander of the 29th Army of the National Revolutionary Army, and Zhang Zizhong's superior.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家、政治家，曾任国民政府主席和军事委员会委员长。
description.en: A Chinese military leader and politician, who served as Chairman of the Nationalist Government and Chairman of the Military Affairs Commission.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事人物，曾为张自忠的直属长官。
description.en: A military figure of the Republic of China, once Zhang Zizhong's direct superior.

description.zh-cn: 中国抗日战争期间的一场重要战役，张自忠在此战役中阵亡。
description.en: A major battle during the Second Sino-Japanese War, in which Zhang Zizhong was killed in action.

description.zh-cn: 枣宜会战中的一部分，张自忠在此战斗中被日军包围并最终殉国。
description.en: Part of the Battle of Zaoyang-Yichang, where Zhang Zizhong was surrounded by Japanese forces and ultimately died.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国在1925年至1947年间的国家军队。
description.en: The national army of the Republic of China from 1925 to 1947.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期的地方军阀部队之一，由冯玉祥建立。
description.en: One of the regional warlord armies during the mainland period of the Republic of China, established by Feng Yuxiang.

nodes.id: 国民革命军第二十九军

zh-cn: 国民革命军第二十九军

description.zh-cn: 由原西北军一部改编而成的国民革命军部队，军长为宋哲元。
description.en: A National Revolutionary Army unit reorganized from a part of the former Northwestern Army, commanded by Song Zheyuan.

description.zh-cn: 中国抗日战争期间的国民革命军集团军之一，张自忠曾任总司令。
description.en: One of the group armies of the National Revolutionary Army during the Second Sino-Japanese War, once commanded by Zhang Zizhong as Commander-in-Chief.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的一个地方政权，管辖河北、察哈尔两省及北平、天津两市。
description.en: A local government of the Republic of China, governing Hebei and Chahar provinces, as well as the cities of Beiping and Tianjin.

nodes.id: 察哈尔省行政首长列表

zh-cn: 察哈尔省行政首长列表

description.zh-cn: 中华民国察哈尔省的最高行政职务。
description.en: The highest administrative position in Chahar Province of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国天津市的最高行政职务。
description.en: The highest administrative position in Tianjin City of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国北平市的最高行政职务。
description.en: The highest administrative position in Beiping City of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 清末由孙中山等组织的革命团体，中国国民党前身。
description.en: A revolutionary group organized by Sun Yat-sen and others in the late Qing Dynasty, the predecessor of the Kuomintang.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国民政部

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国民政部
en: Ministry of Civil Affairs of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国务院主管民政事务的组成部门。
description.en: A constituent department of the State Council of the People's Republic of China responsible for civil affairs.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国训政时期的中央政府与最高行政机关。
description.en: The central government and highest administrative body of the Republic of China during the period of political tutelage.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中华人民共和国、中国人民解放军的主要缔造者和领导人。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China, the People's Republic of China, and the People's Liberation Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会总书记、中华人民共和国主席、中央军事委员会主席。
description.en: General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, President of the People's Republic of China, and Chairman of the Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 张自忠改投冯玉祥的部队，并在其麾下任职多年。
description.en: Zhang Zizhong joined Feng Yuxiang's troops and served under his command for many years.

description.zh-cn: 因战事不利，张自忠恐为其直属长官石友三所害，遂率部脱离。
description.en: Due to unfavorable battle conditions, Zhang Zizhong feared he would be harmed by his direct superior Shi Yousan and thus led his troops to leave.

relationships.target: 国民革命军第二十九军

description.zh-cn: 张自忠在宋哲元担任军长的第二十九军中任师长。
description.en: Zhang Zizhong served as a division commander in the 29th Army, which was commanded by Song Zheyuan.

relationships.target: 察哈尔省行政首长列表

position.en: Chairman of the Chahar Provincial Government

description.zh-cn: 七七事变后，张自忠归于中央政府节制，受军事委员会委员长蒋中正指挥。
description.en: After the Marco Polo Bridge Incident, Zhang Zizhong came under the control of the central government and was commanded by Chiang Kai-shek, the Chairman of the Military Affairs Commission.

description.zh-cn: 张自忠率部在南瓜店与日军激战，最终壮烈殉国。
description.en: Zhang Zizhong led his troops in a fierce battle against the Japanese army at Nanguadian and was ultimately killed in action.

description.zh-cn: 张自忠在枣宜会战期间阵亡。
description.en: Zhang Zizhong was killed in action during the Battle of Zaoyang-Yichang.

description.zh-cn: 张自忠殉国后，国民政府明令褒扬，并追晋其为陆军二级上将。
description.en: After Zhang Zizhong's death, the Nationalist Government issued a commendation and posthumously promoted him to General, Second Class of the Army.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国民政部

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国民政部追认张自忠为革命烈士。
description.en: The Ministry of Civil Affairs of the People's Republic of China posthumously recognized Zhang Zizhong as a revolutionary martyr.

description.zh-cn: 在延安各界举行的追悼大会上，毛泽东为张自忠送上“尽忠报国”的挽词。
description.en: At a memorial service held in Yan'an, Mao Zedong sent a eulogy for Zhang Zizhong with the words 'Loyally serving the country'.

description.zh-cn: 在纪念抗战胜利69周年座谈会上，习近平将张自忠列为中国人民不畏强暴、以身殉国的杰出代表。
description.en: At a symposium commemorating the 69th anniversary of the victory of the War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression, Xi Jinping listed Zhang Zizhong as an outstanding representative of the Chinese people who defied brute force and sacrificed their lives for the country.
